content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Mining and Processing System at (-28, -61) area
Two parallel automated mining and smelting lines (unchanged from previous report)

### Iron Mining and Processing System at (-18, -49) area
Two mining lines with updated collection system (unchanged from previous report)

### Power Generation System (In Progress) at (-66.5, -97.5)
Updated setup of steam-based power generation:
- Offshore pump at (-66.5, -97.5) - Currently working
- Boiler at (-61.5, -93.0) - Not connected
- Multiple pipe groups:
  - Working water pipe group at (-64.5, -97.5)
  - Empty pipe groups at various positions: (-63.5, -98.5), (-61.5, -99.5), (-66.5, -94.5), (-63.5, -95.5), (-63.5, -93.5)

### Research Setup
- Lab placed at (-3.5, -46.5), currently without power (unchanged)

### Additional Processing
Two stone furnaces at (0,0) and (2,0) for iron plate production (unchanged)

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Connection Errors
- Ensure you have the required items (like pipes) in inventory before attempting to connect entities
- When connecting fluid systems, plan the pipe layout to ensure continuous connection between source and destination

### Resource Collection Issues
- Verify the target chest actually contains the items before attempting extraction
- Check chest inventories before attempting to extract items
- Consider implementing a waiting mechanism if resources are being actively produced

### Production Chain Issues
- Ensure all components of a production chain are properly fueled and connected
- Monitor resource production and consumption rates to maintain steady flow
- Keep production chains supplied with required raw materials

### Power System Setup
- Complete water system connections before attempting to start power generation
- Ensure continuous pipe connections between offshore pump and boiler
- Verify boiler has both water input and steam output connections properly set up

### Crafting Requirements
- Remember that iron plates cannot be hand-crafted and require a furnace
- Plan crafting sequences considering both direct materials and intermediate products
- Maintain sufficient stock of basic materials needed for crafting

### System Design
- Leave adequate space between parallel production lines
- Consider fluid and power distribution paths when planning layout
- Ensure proper spacing for inserter pickup and drop positions
- Plan for future expansion when placing initial structures
